alert.note: Alert for Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 22 at 8:12PM MDT until June 22 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN TRIPP COUNTY... At 912 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms that produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen today, on top of 4 or 5 inches yesterday. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern Tripp County, southeast of Colome, along Ponca Creek. There are reports of water covering or washing out roads. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
